NAME

SYNOPSIS

DESCRIPTION

The program provides information on System V interprocess communication (IPC) facilities on the system. The options are as follows: Show the maximum amount of information possible when displaying active semaphores, message queues, and shared memory segments. (This is shorthand for specifying the and options.) Show the maximum allowed sizes for active semaphores, message queues, and shared memory segments. The is the maximum number of bytes in a message on a message queue, the size of a shared memory segment, or the number number of semaphores in a set of semaphores. Show the creator’s name and group for active semaphores, message queues, and shared memory segments. Display information about active shared memory segments. Show outstanding usage for active message queues, and shared memory segments. The is the number of messages in a message queue, or the number of processes attached to a shared memory segment. Show the process ID information for active semaphores, message queues, and shared memory segments. The is the last process to send a message to or receive a message from a message queue, the process that created a semaphore, or the last process to attach or detach a shared memory segment. Display information about active message queues. Display information about active semaphores. Show access times for active semaphores, message queues, and shared memory segments. The access times is the time of the last control operation on an IPC object, the last send or receive of a message, the last attach or detach of a shared memory segment, or the last operation on a semaphore. Extract the name list from the specified system instead of the default Display system information about shared memory. Extract values associated with the name list from the specified core instead of the default and semaphores. Display system information about messages queues. Display system information about semaphores. Display system information about shared memory, message queues If none of the or options are specified, information about all active IPC facilities is listed.

RESTRICTIONS

System data structures may change while is running; the output of is not guaranteed to be consistent.

BUGS

This manual page is woefully incomplete, because it does not at all attempt to explain the information printed by

FILES

default kernel memory default system name list
